name: India: History and Culture Quiz | Asian | 10 Questions

questions.text: What city in India is now known as Chennai?
During the Mughal period of Indian history, the empire was divided into administrative regions known as what?
What former British general who participated in the American revolution was a Lord-Governor of India?
questions.correct: Cornwallis & Lord Cornwallis & Charles Cornwallis & Lord Charles Cornwallis
questions.explanation:
Cornwallis & Lord Cornwallis & Charles Cornwallis & Lord Charles Cornwallis.

	He was seemingly more successful in his Indian assignment.

questions.text: Who was the heroic founder of the Maratha kingdom in south India?
What is the Seven Years War called by Indian historians?
questions.explanation:
3rd Carnatic War.

	Known to Americans as the 'French and Indian War'.

questions.text: What British lord oversaw the defeat of the Bengal Nawab, Suraj-ud-Dowlah, at the battle of Plessey?
Who was the first British Governor-General of Bengal (now India)?
questions.explanation:
Warren Hastings.

	Hastings had a corrupt governorship and was finally impeached in 1785. However, he was acquitted in 1795.

questions.text: The British annexation of what area in India led to the Sepoy Rebellion?
questions.explanation:
Oudh.

	It also didn't help that the British Enfield rifles were greased with the fat of both cows and pigs, considered pollutants to the Hindus and Muslims, respectively!

questions.text: What is the second largest religion of India after Hinduism?
questions.explanation:
Islam.

	By far and away it's Islam, with around 12 percent of the population loyal Muslims, over 100 million people!

questions.text: The destruction of a mosque at what place in India by Hindu militants caused angry reactions by the Muslim community in India?
questions.explanation:
Ayodhya.

	The Hindus claimed that this mosque was built, by the Mughals, on the site of Hindu hero Rama's birthplace.
